Comment: I'd bet good money that Tillis votes for Martin. This is the new GOP playbook - claim uncertainty/unease, then vote yes.
Author: PeterVenkmanIII

Comment: Trump will lose his shit over this one. He really wanted Martin and spent political capital to get him this far.
Author: Starks

Comment: >Tillis’ decision is likely to doom Martin’s hope of his nomination even being reported out of the Senate Judiciary Committee, of which Tillis is a member.  >With Tillis as a “no” vote, the best that Martin could hope for from that committee is a tie vote of 11-11, with Republicans and Democrats evenly split. A tie vote fails to report out a nomination.  This one might actually be meaningful for once, so long as he stands by it as opposed to doing some dumb "I oppose him but believe it deserves a full floor vote" thing that they sometimes do.  >“If Mr. Martin were being put forth as a US Attorney for any district except the district where January 6 happened, the protest happened, I’d probably support him, but not in this district.”  Sounds like he'd pretty easily support him elsewhere though, which isn't a great sign.
Author: redpoemage

Comment: He wouldn’t make a public statement like this if he was going to support him in the end.
Author: Capable-Ad8541
